titles: It is desired by the clerks and gentlemen belonging to the Members of both Houses of Parliament, that all clerks belonging to any of the Inns of Court, ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
notes: Title from opening lines of text.

A request by the clerks and gentlemen belonging to the Members of Parliament, "that all clerks belonging to any of the Inns of Court, or any office in and about London, would be pleased to meet them on Thursday next by seven of the clock in the morning, at the Piatze in Covent-Garden, with spades, shovels, pickaxes, and other necessaries fit for the digging of the trenches."
Dated at end: Dated at Westminster the sixt of June. 1643.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Early works to 1800.
